title: How to Cancel a Subscription in PayPal

steps.title: Sign in to https://www.paypal.com.
steps.content: Sign in to https://www.paypal.com . If you're using a computer, you can use any web browser (such as Chrome, Safari, or Edge) to cancel automatic payments and recurring subscriptions in PayPal . It's not possible to cancel recurring PayPal payments using the mobile app. If you don't have access to a computer, you can use your Android or iPhone's web browser in desktop mode. Chrome: Tap the three-dot menu and select Request desktop site. Safari: Tap the Aa icon and select Request Desktop Website .

steps.title: Click the gear icon.
steps.content: Click the gear icon. It’s at the top-right corner of the page. This takes you to your account settings. If you have a PayPal Business account, you'll see your name at the top-right instead of a gear icon. In this case, use the instructions for Business Accounts instead.

steps.title: Click the Payments tab.
steps.content: Click the Payments tab. You'll see this in the second row of tabs along the top of the screen.

steps.title: Click Manage automatic payments.
steps.content: Click Manage automatic payments . This button is below "Automatic payments" near the middle of the page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select the service you want to cancel.
steps.content: Select the service you want to cancel. Each service with whom you've set up automatic payments appears in the left panel of the page. Clicking a service name brings up information about your past and future payments. If a subscription is still active, you'll see "ACTIVE" below the upcoming payment amount in the right panel. If you don’t see the service or company's name, either the subscription is inactive, or it’s not set up with PayPal. Contact the company’s customer support team to cancel the subscription.

steps.title: Click the Cancel button.
steps.content: Click the Cancel button. It’s at the top of the right panel next to "ACTIVE." [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Cancel Automatic Paymentsl button to confirm.
steps.content: Click the Cancel Automatic Paymentsl button to confirm. The next payment, as well as all subsequent payments, are now canceled.

steps.content: Click the settings gear on the top right of the page. A menu will expand. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Account Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Click Account Settings on the menu. This displays all of your account settings. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Money, bank, and cards tab.
steps.content: Click the Money, bank, and cards tab. You'll see this under "BUSINESS PROFILE" in the left panel.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Manage Automatic Payments.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Manage Automatic Payments . This is a blue link at the bottom of the "Automatic payments" section, which is toward the bottom of the page. [5] X Research source
